text: wow, what it seems so lucky for eric schmidt that this moral imperative will likely also result in him making tons of money.  No conflict of interest there at all

text: US congress: "It's time to appoint a panel, maybe wee should hire a bunch of dispassionate academics who are not drowning in blood money?  Nope sorry, they all sold out already, because we did nothing to stem that particular tide.  You know what, let's just hire a bunch of our lobbyists to be in the panel, it's a win-win really"

text:
So this is slang for "we already have AI weapons we just need to convince the public this is okay."

I personally don't care if people use AI as a weapon, but I don't think its technologically wise, and absolutely not "moral" lol.

elements.text:

text: Call me crazy but it seems like there are more pressing issues at hand - cough- covid19 - cough -

text: what academics are taking blood money???

text: no, what I meant was the academics are the ones not in a position to financially benefit from this sort of thing, but that a lot of academics have gotten gobbled up by the ad companies.  I was somewhat exaggerating the extent to which this has occurred for comedic effect
